metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10024 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xpdf 4.01.01. There is an FPE in the function Splash::scaleImageYuXu at Splash.cc for y Bresenham parameters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> in poppler, this was known as CVE-2017-14520 ebarretto> xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
